name: Certified Cloud Security Professional
subtitle: CCSP
description: As powerful as cloud computing is for the organization, understanding its information security risks and mitigation strategies is critical. Legacy approaches are inadequate, and organizations need competent, experienced professionals equipped with the right cloud security knowledge and skills to be successful. They need CCSPs.

episodes.title: CCSP Overview
episodes.description: As powerful as cloud computing is for the organization, understanding its information security risks and mitigation strategies is critical. Legacy approaches are inadequate, and organizations need competent, experienced professionals equipped with the right cloud security knowledge and skills to be successful. They need CCSPs.

episodes.title: Cloud Architecture
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike discuss cloud basics. They define some basic cloud terminology. They discuss different service models and deployment models. They also talk about multi-tenancy issues.

episodes.title: Architecture Planning Models
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike discuss two different cloud architecture models. They talk about the CSA Cloud Reference Model and the Jerico Cloud Cube Model.

episodes.title: Security Planning Models
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike begin the discussion of cloud security. They talk about security issues that need to be considered when moving to the cloud. They also discuss some legal issues that must be considered when considering moving to the cloud.

episodes.title: Hosting Provider Considerations
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike talk about selecting a service provider. They cover some potential hosting issues that need to be considered, and questions that should be asked. They also discuss private vs. public solutions, and service level agreements.

episodes.title: Security and CSP Requirements
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike discuss some security requirements to consider when choosing an ISP. They talk about risk to consider, and potential solutions to security problems. They also talk about contractual security requirements.

episodes.title: Risk Management and the Cloud
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike talk about risk management and how it translates to the cloud.

episodes.title: Cloud Deployment Examples
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike explore some of the current offerings from various cloud service providers. They talk about considerations when deciding on a CSP.

episodes.title: Legal Issues with the Cloud
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike talk about some of the legal aspects of moving to the cloud.

episodes.title: Dealing with Investigations
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike discuss dealing with investigations. They talk about how moving to the cloud changes how investigations can be done. They also talk about litigation hold.

episodes.title: Compliance and Audits
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike discuss how compliance and auditing are affected by the cloud. They talk about audit policies and the right to audit. They also talk about compliance analysis and auditor requirements.

episodes.title: Data Security Lifecycle
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike discuss the six phases of the data security lifecycle. They talk about how the lifecycle changes as data is moved to the cloud.

episodes.title: Storage Locations and Issues
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike take a look at storage options. They discuss volume storage as well as object storage. They also talk about logical vs. physical data location.

episodes.title: Data Loss Prevention Issues
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike discuss different ways to protect against data loss in the cloud. They talk about backup, replication and offsite storage. They also look at the data loss prevention process.

episodes.title: Protecting Data within the Cloud
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike talk about migrating data to the cloud. They discuss migrating data to the cloud and different encryption options. They also talk about database and file activity monitoring.

episodes.title: Data Storage within the Cloud
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike talk about storing data in the cloud. They discuss data backup strategies, as it pertains to the cloud. Then they talk about data dispersion, sharding data and data fragmentation.

episodes.title: Portability and Interoperability
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike define the concepts of protability and interoperability in the cloud. They talk about how virtualization can impact these areas. They also discuss SAML and WS-Security.

episodes.title: CSP and Data Security
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike discuss storage concerns when moving to the cloud. They talk about the concept of lock-in at the different delivery models, Iaas,Paas and SaaS. They also talk about mitigating hardware compatibility issues.

episodes.title: Incident Handling
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike talk about how incident handling changes once you move to the cloud. They talk about verifying physical security of CSP data centers.

episodes.title: BCM, BCP and DRM
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike discuss how moving to the cloud could impact your BCM, BCP and DRM.

episodes.title: Data Center Issues
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike look at data hosting in relation to the Cloud Controls Matrix. They discuss integration and cross organization issues in data centers. They also talk about logging and reporting in multi-site clouds.

episodes.title: Incident Response Review
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike review the concept of of incident response and issues with the cloud. They talk about the value of incident response and compare traditional incidents with cloud incidents.

episodes.title: Cloud Incident Response
episodes.description: In this episode Sean and Mike discuss factors allowing more efficient and effective containment and recovery in a cloud. They talk about detection and analysis, and containing an incident in an IaaS.

episodes.title: Cloud Incident Response Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode Sean and Mike talk about reducing the occurrence of application level incidents. They discuss the frequency of incident response testing and offline analysis of potential incidents.

episodes.title: Application Security and IdEA
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike talk about Identity, Entitlement and Access Management (IdEA). Then they review the software development lifecycle (SDLC). They discuss how these processes are used to prepare to move applications to the cloud.

episodes.title: Additional Application Issues
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike discuss additional considerations for supporting applications hosted in the cloud. They talk about what changes in the pen-testing process, performance monitoring and auditing.

episodes.title: Encryption Issues
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike talk about concerns with encryption as we move to the cloud. They also discuss how multi-national cloud deployments can complicate a cloud deployment.

episodes.title: IdEA
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike cover the concept of Identity, Entitlement and Access Management (IdEA). They talk about the relationship between identities and attributes, and identity federation. They cover the concepts of Policy Decision Point (PDP) and Policy Enforcement Point (PEP).

episodes.title: Virtualization
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike discuss security concerns with hypervisors. They talk about VM guest hardening, VM sprawl, and data commingling. They also talk about characteristics that can create complexity in auditing.

episodes.title: Outsourcing Security to the Cloud
episodes.description: In this episode, Sean and Mike discuss Security as a Service (SECaaS). They talk about some of the obstacles and concerns with SECaaS. They also cover using SECaaS in a regulated industry.
